title: Are Paul McCartney and Eric Clapton friends? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the 60s, I’ve read they were at the same club watching Hendrix perform live .. and think all of them probably were at the same places when young in the 60s, … perhaps later. In recent years they’ve performed together (see below) but coming out of the 1960s, their music was definitely different. Clapton, like the Beatles’ Harrison, loved what the Band were doing in upper state New York, and it really changed his music style in the 70s. McCartney, on the other hand, established himself as a solo artist pretty much evolving and adapting his Beatles-type sound. Still they’ve shared the stage sporadically through the decades, and don’t think they’d do that if they weren’t friendly. Here are some recent performances While My Guitar Gently Weeps by Harrison for the White Album, on which Clapton originally was a guest guitarist for the track.  The Beatles “Abbey Road” Medley (Lennon and McCartney) for a 1997 benefit. Gotta wait until the end with for 3-guitar interplay with Clapton, McCartney, and Knofler (like the original interplay with Lennon, McCartney, and Harrison)  Well not really “the End” .. close to the end.
